Class Option

A static class for constructing Options in a more explicit way, if desired.

Inheritance
System.Object
Option
Namespace: FunctionalLink.Next
Assembly: FunctionalLink.Next.dll
Syntax
public static class Option : Object

Methods

Maybe<T>(T)

This is an alternate constructor for creating an Option from an unknown nullable value.

Declaration
public static Option<T> Maybe<T>(T value)
Parameters
Type Name Description
T value

The target value
Returns
Type Description
Option<T>

An Option in the Some state if value is not null. Otherwise in the None state
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

The target value type

None()

This is an alternate constructor for creating an Option in a None state.

Declaration
public static None None()
Returns
Type Description
None

An Option in a None state
Remarks

These are equivalent constructors:

None();
Option.None();
Option<int>.None();

Some<T>(T)

This is an alternate constructor for creating an Option in a Some state.

Declaration
public static Option<T> Some<T>(T value)
Parameters
Type Name Description
T value

The target value
Returns
Type Description
Option<T>

An Option in a Some state
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

The type of the target value
Remarks

This class enables you to create Options like so:

public static Option<int> Divide(int a, int b) =>
    b != 0
        ? Option.Some(a / b)
        : Option.None();

These are all equivalent constructors:

Some(123);
Option.Some(123);
Option<int>.Some(123);
